intro: Heisteria ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf heister, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. The flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow and are followed by small, round fruits.
